A Gateway represents an instance of a se: A Gateway represents an instance of a service-traffic handling infrastructure by binding Listeners to a set of IP addresses.
A list of actions to perform on a reques: A list of actions to perform on a request or response before it is sent to the backend.
A map of key/value pairs to enable imple: A map of key/value pairs to enable implementation-specific TLS options, such as minimum TLS version or cipher suites.
A unique name for the gateway within the: A unique name for the gateway within the namespace.
A unique name for this listener within t: A unique name for this listener within the gateway.
Add, set, or remove request headers.
Add, set, or remove response headers.
Allow from namespaces matching a specifi: Allow from namespaces matching a specific label.
Allow only from the Gateway's namespace.
At least one listener is required to cre: At least one listener is required to create a Gateway.
At least one parent reference required f: At least one parent reference required for the HTTPRoute
Certificate references for TLS terminati: Certificate references for TLS termination. Specify the name, namespace, and kind of the certificate resource.
Defines the criteria for a request to ma: Defines the criteria for a request to match this rule. If multiple matches are specified, they are OR ed. If omitted, this rule matches all requests.

Defines the criteria for a request to match this rule. If multiple matches are specified, they are OR ed. If omitted, this rule matches all requests. Multiple Matches in one Rule share all BackendRefs.
Gateway class cannot be changed after cr: Gateway class cannot be changed after creation.
Gateway names cannot be changed after cr: Gateway names cannot be changed after creation.
HTTPRoute provides a way to route HTTP r: HTTPRoute provides a way to route HTTP requests to backends.
Listener is not available for route bind: Listener is not available for route binding.
Listeners define how the Gateway accepts: Listeners define how the Gateway accepts traffic. Each listener specifies a protocol, port, and hostname to match incoming requests.
Missing required metadata fields (uid, r: Missing required metadata fields (uid, resourceVersion) for {{kind}} update
Name: Name
No rules defined. HTTPRoute will use def: No rules defined. HTTPRoute will use default routing.
Only HTTPRoute is supported by this Gate: Only HTTPRoute is supported by this Gateway.
Optional hostname to match requests. Lea: Optional hostname to match requests. Leave empty to match all hostnames.
Redirect the request to a different host: Redirect the request to a different hostname, path, or port.
Request a specific static IP address or: Request a specific static IP address or hostname for the Gateway. This is optional and used to specify where the Gateway should be accessible.
Restricts the types of Route resources t: Restricts the types of Route resources that can attach to this listener (e.g., only HTTPRoute).
Rewrite the hostname or path of the requ: Rewrite the hostname or path of the request before forwarding.
Rules define how to route HTTP requests: Rules define how to route HTTP requests to backend services
Send a copy of the request to a differen: Send a copy of the request to a different backend (for traffic shadowing).
Some references for the HTTPRoute could: Some references for the HTTPRoute could not be resolved.
Specifies the Gateway(s) this route shou: Specifies the Gateway(s) this route should attach to. You can
Specify static IP addresses or hostnames: Specify static IP addresses or hostnames where the Gateway should be accessible. This is optional and depends on your infrastructure setup.
The gateway class name must be unique wi: The gateway class name must be unique within the namespace and conform to DNS-1123 label standards (lowercase alphanumeric characters or "-").
The Gateway configuration is accepted bu: The Gateway configuration is accepted but not yet programmed.
The Gateway has issues and is not ready: The Gateway has issues and is not ready to serve traffic.
The Gateway is accepted and programmed i: The Gateway is accepted and programmed in the data plane.
The Gateway is accepted, programmed, and: The Gateway is accepted, programmed, and ready to serve traffic.
The HTTPRoute is accepted by at least on: The HTTPRoute is accepted by at least one parent gateway.
The HTTPRoute is not accepted by any par: The HTTPRoute is not accepted by any parent gateways.
The network port that this listener will: The network port that this listener will bind to (1-65535).
The protocol that this listener will acc: The protocol that this listener will accept.
The status of the resource is unknown.
This resource has no related items confi: This resource has no related items configured
TLS termination mode. Terminate decrypts: TLS termination mode. Terminate decrypts TLS at the gateway, Passthrough forwards encrypted traffic.
